intro: Omphalea philippinensis, commonly known as the Philippine crownleaf, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its palmate leaves and yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its fruit is a capsule that contains several seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Omphalea philippinensis is often found in lowland areas and is adapted to humid tropical climates.
